intro: Lupinus bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá lupine, is a flowering plant native to the high Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces spiny, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, which are often used as forage for livestock. Lupinus bogotensis thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat.
